item.title: SQLi attack
item.author: Hato0
item.description: SQL injection A SQL injection (SQLi) is a type of security exploit in which the attacker adds Structured Query Language (SQL) code to a Web form input box in order to gain access to unauthorized resources or make changes to sensitive data. An SQL query is a request for some action to be performed on a database. When executed correctly, a SQL injection can expose intellectual property, the personal information of customers, administrative credentials or private business details.
